title: Gifting Trade system.
body:
Riot Should Implement a System in which there are various options where two players can exchange skins/champs without the fear of one player not meeting to their end of the deal. This has recently occurred to me, where i have been "Dooped" Into gifting someone a mystery Champ with the full mindset of getting a champ in return, and of course I was unfriended and left without my 475 RP. Implementing a system where two summoners can trade without the fear of this occurring should be imminent. 

One way that this could work is to have both the summoners select an option of choice eg. Mystery Champ Trade, both summoners appear in some sort of lobby where they will both purchase the Mystery Champs temporarily, and until both summoners purchase the skins the trade will not occur. This Event could have a timer set to 3 mins for example, so that you don't end up getting trolled.

Therefore no-one loses any RP and does not end up feeling like me.

replies.body: Even if people can avoid this type of fraud by just trading with people who you know and trust in Reality, Why no have a system where two players can trade gifts? Wouldn't it be nice to actually trust someone on-line for once without any concern of fraud?

That would be cool, if we can get one like the good ol' WoW trading system where both parties engage in a trade 
1.  The items of trade will be shown to both parties engaged
2. And both parties has to confirm the trade for it to finalise.

If you still get scammed by that, that would only be your fault.

Why do people even believe in trading gifts on league? Its like the Nigerian prince scam. Only trade with people you know and trust IRL.

On the other hand, your idea is pretty good.
This is merely a fix for the large amount of people who do get scammed! Thanks. Also what happens if your RL Friends aren't into League. The Bottom line is it occurs and something should be done.
They shouldn't be getting scammed in the first place, it's your own fault if you do.

Yeah, and i take full responsibility however the reality is that these people can do this and get away with it. It happens, and it shouldn't. There are also genuine people who you meet on-line, this is a way to stop the mischievous summoners and make it so you can trade with people with no fear of this occurring.
If you report them they get banned.

Although this is true, you are left without your 475 RP, and nothing else is done. ( To my understanding )

I have reported the person who has done this to me, so far Riot has told me nothing of the outcome due to security reasons. ( Meaning the outcome has happened and I still haven't got my mystery champ yet.

I Know what angle you are coming from, but eliminating this event from ever occurring would mean that you wouldn't ever have to report someone for this fraudulent event.
Thanks for you input!
